items.title: UK-India FTA: Sectoral shake up – who gains, who loses?
items.description: Key Indian export sectors to benefit are, textiles, leather, footwear, marine products, gems & jewellery, auto parts, engineering goods, and organic chemicals.

items.title: CEAT: Is the risk-reward turning favourable?
items.description: Healthy volume-led growth in Q4 FY25, though margins remained under pressure due to high raw material prices.

items.title: Himadri Specialty: Near-term growth triggers missing
items.description: Given the weak domestic demand for the auto sector, an unfavourable supply-demand balance is likely to show up in margins

items.title: Union Cabinet approves revamped coal allocation policy as India plans to expand its thermal power capacity
items.description: The revised policy will offer an opportunity to a number of private companies who have won commercial and captive coal mines in the government's auctions to set up thermal power plants in the future.

items.title: USFDA expands unannounced inspections abroad, raising stakes for Indian drugmakers
items.description: The USFDA conducts around 3,000 foreign inspections annually, many of which involve Indian pharmaceutical plants that supply a substantial share of generic drugs to the U.S. market.

items.title: Alembic Pharma eyes FY26 growth with optimism across domestic, US, and global markets
items.description: 'As we ramp up our revenues and my facilities get optimally utilised, my EBITDA margin should only go up from here,' RK Baheti, CFO of the Vadodara-based company, said

items.title: Aster DM Healthcare to set up another hospital in Bengaluru, invest Rs 480 crore
items.description: The hospital in Sarjapur, to be developed in phases, positions Aster among the top three healthcare providers in the region, with a total bed capacity exceeding 2,000
